newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAFRICAN LABOUR CONCILIATION BODY CLAIMS SUCCESS.
newsitem.headline: SAFRICAN LABOUR CONCILIATION BODY CLAIMS SUCCESS.

text.p: South Africa's Commission for Conciliation, Mediation and Arbitration (CCMA) had achieved an 86 percent success rate since being established in November, Labour Minister Tito Mboweni said on Thursday.
"From November 11 (1996) to December 31 the CCMA dealt with 1,380 disputes," Mboweni told a news conference where the commission's first annual report was presented.
"Of these it conciliated 1,244 cases, of which 1,064 were settled -- a settlement rate of 86 percent," he said.
He said the bulk of cases dealt with by the CCMA concerned claims of unfair dismissals. A rugby coach had been among the complainants, Mboweni said, without naming him.
